repo.description: Vim-fork focused on extensibility and usability
repo.name: neovim

body:
Problem:
1. wrong startcol value this will cause compl_orgi_text will match triggercharacter then when new leader add compl_leader will include triggercharacter, then compl_match_array will build failed.
2. wrong word generate this will include symbol like `->` , it will make compl_match_array build failed 
2. if isIncomplete is true and next request matches is empty invoke complete function will remove current pum.

Solution:
1. use max value of server_bounary, word_boundary
2. use vimregex keyword remove unncessary symbols.
3. only invoke complete when matches not empty

now

![now](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ed3d7522-8b0b-4d8c-a9a1-9ea153f2b8d9)

After

![after](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/cf8565c1-ea41-4676-95ec-be6febbab1fc)

comment_data.body: Not sure about this trim. If there's leading whitespace I feel like either the label is incorrect or the space is intentional.
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -265,7 +270,7 @@ function M._lsp_to_complete_items(result, prefix, client_id)
       end
       local completion_item = {
         word = word,
-        abbr = item.label,
+        abbr = vim.trim(item.label),

comment_data.body:
https://github.com/llvm/llvm-project/blob/7ba6768df8181bc270763333969d4a1d6cc2e160/mlir/lib/Tools/mlir-pdll-lsp-server/PDLLServer.cpp#L709

there is no trim so we can assume that the server did this on purpose? currently I can accept only one space. If there are multiple spaces in the prefix, it will increase the width of the pum.  spaces have meaning in the abbr? The abbr is only displayed in the pum and does not actually have any effect.

       end

         word = word,
-        abbr = item.label,
+        abbr = vim.trim(item.label),

comment_data.body:
clangd prefixes some items with a •, so I assume the space is to keep all items aligned:

```
 a                                                                Variable   std::unique_ptr<A>
 A                                                                Struct
•ADJ_ESTERROR                                                     Text
•ADJ_FREQUENCY                                                    Text
```
comment_data.diff_hunk:
@@ -265,7 +270,7 @@ function M._lsp_to_complete_items(result, prefix, client_id)
       end
       local completion_item = {
         word = word,
-        abbr = item.label,
+        abbr = vim.trim(item.label),

@@ -154,8 +154,13 @@ local function get_completion_word(item)
       return item.label
     end
   elseif item.textEdit then
-    local word = item.textEdit.newText
-    return word:match('^(%S*)') or word
+    local word = item.textEdit.newText:gsub('%s+$', '')
+    if word:match('^%W') then
+      local matched_word = vim.fn.matchstr(word, '\\k\\+')
+      return matched_word ~= '' and matched_word or word
+    else
+      return word
+    end

comment_data.body:
It's often useful to show a short input/output example
```suggestion
      -- "..." => "..."
      local matched_word = vim.fn.matchstr(word, '\\k\\+')
```

comment_regular_data.body:
seems like vscode also add new completion list when length > 0 
https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/789c320a1c67bb0547cdef2b8b82634bf93929a3/extensions/npm/src/features/jsonContributions.ts#L142

> seems like vscode also add new completion list when length > 0 https://github.com/microsoft/vscode/blob/789c320a1c67bb0547cdef2b8b82634bf93929a3/extensions/npm/src/features/jsonContributions.ts#L142

`items.length > 0 || isIncomplete` - the `|| isIncomplete` would match my point about it being able to narrow/finish the completion if there are no more candidates, no?
I still don't understand why you want to get rid of this behavior.

If I understand the problem description of the PR right, only the `word` change is required, and the trim + empty matches change could be reverted?
yes you are right . i check it again because the wrong prefix value in _convert_results it sub prefix to `.w` then client_matchs is empty in second request.

title: fix(lsp): wrong startcol and avoid pum deleted
